info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 13 at 8:31PM CDT until June 14 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN WHEELER AND NORTHERN COLLINGSWORTH COUNTIES... At 830 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Shamrock, moving southeast at 55 mph. THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE STORM FOR RURAL AREAS OF NORTHEASTERN COLLINGSWORTH AND SOUTHEASTERN WHEELER COUNTIES. HAZARD...80 mph wind gusts and two inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be heavily damaged. Expect considerable damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles. Tree damage and power outages are likely. People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Locations impacted include... Shamrock, Dozier, Lutie, Lela, Samnorwood and Twitty. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...DESTRUCTIVE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...80 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows. This is a dangerous storm, capable of producing large hail driven by severe winds! SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows! If you are caught outdoors, cover your head and neck.
